page.title: 10N. Lopham School, 1950's
page.content:
Mr. Potter, father of Michelle who described the village school today, attended the same school approximately 1952-1963.
There were 100 children in North Lopham school then. Mr. Potter said he liked it sometimes. The main work was reading, writing and sums. The sports equipment was skipping ropes and balls. It was very strict. The uniform was short trousers and a cap and jacket.
By the time Mr. Potter went to school, school dinners had started. The games he played were marbles and football. He had the cane a lot. The cane was used for any little thing. He says that everything has changed. He would like school now, not how it used to be.
